fields.description:
Especially in our examples. I traced the problem down to the bundled styles. Given that most likely our users use them too, we better fix that in the code rather than working around with runner changes.

Of course, runner changes are possible - we can insert the stylesheets statically and use noStyle. This will be a (relatively) large change, though.
fields.summary: calling sizeColumnsToFit in GridReady does not work reliably

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Pressing control-enter in an editor clears the cell content and doesn't close the editor.

The control-enter triggers a keypress event after the keydown (which is closing the editor, as expected). CellComp.onKeyPress reads the charCode as 10 (instead of 13 for 'enter'), which is processed as a \n character. This goes to Utils.isEventFromPrintableCharacter which incorrectly classifies the \n as printable. Then, because the user has 'input' a 'printable' character on a cell that's not editing, it starts editing, using \n as the initially typed character.
fields.summary: [edit] Ctrl-Enter resets cell editor to blank

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When you mouse wheel, the grid consumes the event, so the default window scrolling doesn't happen. Steps to reproduce ag-grid-docs/src/javascript-grid-pinning/examplePinned.html
ag-grid-docs/src/javascript-grid-pinning/examplePinned.js var columnDefs = [ {headerName: "Athlete", field: "athlete", width: 150, pinned: 'left'}, {headerName: "Age", field: "age", width: 90}, {headerName: "Country", field: "country", width: 120}, {headerName: "Year", field: "year", width: 90}, {headerName: "Date", field: "date", width: 110}, {headerName: "Sport", field: "sport", width: 110}, {headerName: "Gold", field: "gold", width: 100}, {headerName: "Silver", field: "silver", width: 100}, {headerName: "Bronze", field: "bronze", width: 100}, {headerName: "Total", field: "total", width: 100} ]; Now you'll be able to scroll up/down on the right (non pinned side of things), but not when over the pinned column
fields.summary: [scrolling] when pinning, and no V scroll, scroll not propagated to window

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Not easy to reproduce, but click around, sort etc and eventually a hamburger will appear

This is confusing to users as it implies it can be clicked on.

Niall note - I went to look into this - it's tricky, as we don't know when the user is on iPad or a device where we should not be showing the hamburger. We could check for touch, however some devices (eg touch screen windows machines) allow both touch and mouse, so cannot be 'one or the other'. One solution would be to suppress the hamburger in the menu - however I'd like to take a step back and think about how the headers are configured rather than hack a fix in for this (the fix would be a property 'suppressHamburger' which the user would set, and suppress the hamburger but still allow the touch support for showing the menu). . . . . . . or we do nothing and just live with it, fixing it would cause other issues (eg if we got the grid to not show the hamburger, then we would not show it sometimes when the user wants it shown).
fields.summary: [iPad] hamburger occasionally appears but cannot be clicked

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Current behavior
Calling api.refreshCells() on a floating row doesn't trigger the floatingCellRenderer.

Expected behavior
floatingCellRenderer should be called again.

Minimal reproduction of the problem with instructions
var rowNode = api.getFloatingBottomRow(0);
api.refreshCells([rowNode], ['selection']);

ag-Grid version: latest
I believe the error is due to iterating this.renderedRows in RowRenderer.prototype.refreshCells(). The floating row isn't in the rendererRows array.
fields.summary: [floating renderer] refreshCells on Floating Rows not refreshing them

fields.description:
Open any example grid in a new tab in Google Chrome - e.g. https://ag-grid.com/javascript-grid-column-spanning/exampleColumnSpanning.html

Open the console.

Type:

domGrid = document.getElementById('myGrid')
domGrid.webkitRequestFullscreen()

The width will shrink to the width of the toolpanel
fields.summary: [full screen] Grid in fullscreen mode collapses to tool panel width in Chrome
